abstract: A.I.G. has formally requested that its former chief executive, Maurice Greenberg, be barred from suing the federal government on the insurer’s behalf, after the company decided not to join his lawsuit.
snippet: A.I.G. has formally requested that its former chief executive, Maurice Greenberg, be barred from suing the federal government on the insurer’s behalf, after the company decided not to join his lawsuit.

headline.main: A.I.G. Seeks to Bar Greenberg From Suing U.S. on Its Behalf

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
